column2: It is not beyond reason that his allegiance is to another power, Dawsbergen, for instance.
column3: It is not beyond reason that his allegiance is to another power, Dawsbergen, for instance.

column2: Count Marlanx is not at all in sympathy with him, you are aware.
column3: Count Marlanx is not at all in sympathy with him, you are aware.

column2: He is convinced that Baldos is a man of consequence, possibly one of our bitterest enemies, and he hates him.
column3: He is convinced that Baldos is a man of consequence, possibly one of our bitterest enemies, and he hates him.

column2: For my own part, I may say that I like the man.
column3: For my own part, I may say that I like the man.

column2: I believe he is to be trusted, but if he be an agent of Volga or Gabriel, his opportunity has come.
column3: I believe he is to be trusted, but if he be an agent of Volga or Gabriel, his opportunity has come.

column2: He is in a position to make accurate maps of the fort and of all our masked fortifications along the city walls." Beyond a doubt, the baron was worried.
column3: He is in a position to make accurate maps of the fort and of all our masked fortifications along the city walls." Beyond a doubt, the baron was worried.

column2: Neither am I one of you, said Beverly stoutly.
column3: Neither am I one of you, said Beverly stoutly.

column2: Why shouldn't I prove to be a traitress?
column3: Why shouldn't I prove to be a traitress?

column2: You have no quarrel with us, Miss Calhoun, said Dangloss.
column3: You have no quarrel with us, Miss Calhoun, said Dangloss.

column2: If anything happens, then, I am to be blamed for it, she cried in deep distress.
column3: If anything happens, then, I am to be blamed for it, she cried in deep distress.

column2: I brought him to Edelweiss, and I believe in him.
column3: I brought him to Edelweiss, and I believe in him.

column2: For his own sake, your highness, and Miss Calhoun, I suggest that no opportunity should be given him to communicate with the outside world.	For his own sake, your highness, and Miss Calhoun, I suggest that no opportunity should be given him to communicate with the outside world.
column3: true

column2: We cannot accuse him, of course, but we can _protect_ him. I come to ask your permission to have him detailed for duty only in places where no suspicion can attach to any of his actions."
column3: We cannot accuse him, of course, but we can underscore protect underscore him. I come to ask your permission to have him detailed for duty only in places where no suspicion can attach to any of his actions."

column2: You mean inside the city walls? asked Yetive.
column3: You mean inside the city walls? asked Yetive.

column2: Yes, your highness, and as far as possible from the fortress.
column3: Yes, your highness, and as far as possible from the fortress.

column2: I think it is a wise precaution.	I think it is a wise precaution.
column3: true

column2: Don't be angry, Beverly," the princess said gently.
column3: Don't be angry, Beverly," the princess said gently.

column2: It is for his own sake, you see.	It is for his own sake, you see.
column3: true

column2: I am acting on the presumption that he is wholly innocent of any desire to betray us."
column3: I am acting on the presumption that he is wholly innocent of any desire to betray us."

column2: It would be easy for someone high in position to accuse and convict him, said Dangloss meaningly.
column3: It would be easy for someone high in position to accuse and convict him, said Dangloss meaningly.

column2: And it would be just like someone, too, agreed Beverly, her thoughts, with the others', going toward none but one man "high in power."
column3: And it would be just like someone, too, agreed Beverly, her thoughts, with the others', going toward none but one man "high in power."

column2: Later in the day she called Baldos to her side as they were riding in the castle avenue.
column3: Later in the day she called Baldos to her side as they were riding in the castle avenue.

column2: She was determined to try a little experiment of her own.
column3: She was determined to try a little experiment of her own.

column2: Baldos, what do you think of the fortress? she
column3: Baldos, what do you think of the fortress? she

column2: I could overthrow it after half an hour's bombardment, your highness, he answered, without thinking.
column3: I could overthrow it after half an hour's bombardment, your highness, he answered, without thinking.

column2: She started violently.
column3: She started violently.

column2: Is it possible?	Is it possible?

column2: Are there so many weak points?" she went on, catching her breath.
column3: Are there so many weak points?" she went on, catching her breath.

column2: There are three vital points of weakness, your highness.	There are three vital points of weakness, your highness.
column3: true

column2: The magazine can be reached from the outside if one knows the lay of the land; the parade-ground exposes the ammunition building to certain disadvantages, and the big guns could be silenced in an hour if an enemy had the sense first to bombard from the elevation northeast of the city."
column3: The magazine can be reached from the outside if one knows the lay of the land; the parade ground exposes the ammunition building to certain disadvantages, and the big guns could be silenced in an hour if an enemy had the sense first to bombard from the elevation northeast of the city."

column2: Good heavens! gasped poor Beverly.
column3: Good heavens! gasped poor Beverly.

column2: Have you studied all this out?
column3: Have you studied all this out?

column2: I was once a real soldier, your highness, he said, simply.
column3: I was once a real soldier, your highness, he said, simply.

column2: It was impossible for me not to see the defects in your fort.
column3: It was impossible for me not to see the defects in your fort.

column2: You--you haven't told anyone of this, have you? she cried, white-faced and anxious.
column3: You-you haven't told anyone of this, have you? she cried, white faced and anxious.

column2: No one but your highness.	No one but your highness.

column2: You do not employ me as a tale-bearer, I trust."
column3: You do not employ me as a tale bearer, I trust."

column2: I did not mean to question your honor, she said.

column2: Would you mind going before the heads of the war department and tell them just what you have told me?	Would you mind going before the heads of the war department and tell them just what you have told me?

column2: If it is your command, your highness, he said quietly, but he was surprised.

column2: You may expect to be summoned then, so hold yourself in readiness.	You may expect to be summoned then, so hold yourself in readiness.

column2: And, Baldos--"
column3: And, Baldos-"

column2: Yes, your highness?

column2: You need say nothing to them of our having talked the matter over beforehand--unless they pin you down to it, you know.
